title: World map/History

properties.name: description
properties.value: The following is an archive of official world maps released by Jagex on their website and prior to that, the web client.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:World map/History

The following is an archive of official world maps released by Jagex on their website and prior to that, the web client.

Map Date of release Notes
24 July 2007 The map closest in date to the August 2007 Archive of RuneScape, this map was used for the launch of Old School RuneScape.
3 April 2014 Released in a newspost, the map was created by a player named Oyuu and was sent to Jagex, which they adopted as the official map. A label named "Map by Oyuu" can be seen north of the Necromancer Tower.
June 2014 The map was made larger in size. Clan Wars was added to the Desert Plateau, and a pen was added north of the Tree Gnome Stronghold for community streams.

A dungeon icon leading to the Poison Waste Slayer Dungeon, which never existed in Old School RuneScape, was removed.

August 2014 Poll booths were added to every bank.
8 January 2015 Zul-Andra was added.
February 2015 The Grand Exchange was added north-west of Varrock. As a result, Varrock's western walls were opened up, and Lucien's house and the Outlaw Camp were relocated. Also, the Lumbridge farmlands were changed.
April 2015 Achievement Diaries were released, alongside an expansion of the Cooks' Guild and a new furnace in Edgeville as potential rewards.
7 January 2016 The map now includes Great Kourend and completes the north-west corner of Prifddinas.
14 January 2016 The centre of Great Kourend has roads added, and a stray rare tree icon was removed.
21 January 2016 An area was added west of the Lizardman Canyon, containing lizardman shamans. The Mermaid storage unit was also removed.
25 February 2016 A clothes shop icon was added where Osten is, and the Vinery is properly labeled now that it is accessible.
3 March 2016 In Great Kourend, more pathways and roads were added, and the centre has been redesigned from a large clear field with the statue in the centre to a large, tall monument.
12 May 2016 In Great Kourend, several shop and mining site icons were added, while some map icons were added to Ape Atoll with the release of Monkey Madness II.
1 June 2016 The Woodcutting Guild was added, and transportation icons were added for the Lovakengj Minecart Network.
8 September 2016 The Wintertodt Camp was added.
17 November 2016 A major rework of Great Kourend was released, and an island in the shape of an easter egg was added, which would later be the location of the 2017 Easter event.
7 January 2017 Mount Quidamortem was added.
27 April 2017 Various dungeon entrances were added to relocate monsters that were once found in the Stronghold Slayer Cave.
6 September 2017 The map was brightened and sees the addition of Fossil Island.
23 November 2017 The entrance to the Revenant Caves was added, the map was cropped, and much of the Western Sea was blacked out. Labels on Fossil Island were removed.
5 December 2017 The Corsair Cove and Myths' Guild was added, though the latter was not yet accessible.
25 January 2018 Ungael was added, map icons were added to the Myths' Guild, and Fossil Island's labels were restored.
22 May 2018 The Sanguinesti region sees the release of Slepe and Ver Sinhaza. Darkmeyer was now labeled on the map, though not yet accessible.

Some labels were changed in Great Kourend as well; namely, "Zeah" was removed from usage and the Kebos Lowlands was named.

6 September 2018 The font size of the map labels were reduced, and Weiss was added to the map.
10 January 2019 The Kebos Lowlands was added, Wester Island was removed, and changes to the map label's font size were reverted.
23 May 2019 Hosidius was graphically reworked.
18 July 2019 Prifddinas was updated, adding a new area north of the city.
27 May 2020 The Island of Stone was added, and an updated Darkmeyer was released.
14 July 2020 Ferox Enclave was added, and the old Clan Wars area is replaced by the Desert Plateau.
7 December 2020 The Isle of Souls was added.
27 January 2021 Some new wheat fields were added. The Ruins of Unkah and the Sea Spirit Dock, the place were players will travel to fight Tempoross, were added, though it does not yet appear in game.
3 June 2021 The Isle of Souls has had map icons added to it, the Games Zone and the Clan Hub have been added, and Shayzien has been reworked entirely.
rawContent:
{{external|rs}}
The following is an archive of official world maps released by [[Jagex]] on their [https://www.runescape.com/oldschool/world-map website] and prior to that, the web client.

{| class="wikitable" style="width:750px;"
|+
|-
!Map
!Date of release
!Notes
|-
|[[File:World map (24-07-2007).jpg|300px]]
|24 July 2007
|The map closest in date to the [[August 2007 Archive of RuneScape]], this map was used for the launch of Old School RuneScape.
|-
|[[File:World map (03-04-2014).jpg|300px]]
|3 April 2014
|Released in a [[Update:Chaos Elemental Pet & World Map|newspost]], the map was created by a player named ''Oyuu'' and was sent to Jagex, which they adopted as the official map. A label named "Map by Oyuu" can be seen north of the [[Necromancer Tower]].
|-
|[[File:World map (June 2014).png|300px]]
|June 2014
|The map was made larger in size. [[Clan Wars]] was added to the Desert Plateau, and a pen was added north of the [[Tree Gnome Stronghold]] for community streams.

A dungeon icon leading to the {{RSL|Poison Waste Slayer Dungeon}}, which never existed in Old School RuneScape, was removed.
|-
|[[File:World map (August 2014).png|300px]]
|August 2014
|Poll booths were added to every bank.
|-
|[[File:World map (05-01-2015).png|300px]]
|8 January 2015
|[[Zul-Andra]] was added.
|-
|[[File:World map (February 2015).png|300px]]
|February 2015
|The [[Grand Exchange]] was added north-west of Varrock. As a result, Varrock's western walls were opened up, and Lucien's house and the [[Outlaw Camp]] were relocated. Also, the Lumbridge farmlands were changed.
|-
|[[File:World map (April 2015).png|300px]]
|April 2015
|Achievement Diaries were released, alongside an expansion of the [[Cooks' Guild]] and a new furnace in [[Edgeville]] as potential rewards.
|-
|[[File:World map (07-01-2016).png|300px]]
|7 January 2016
|The map now includes [[Great Kourend]] and completes the north-west corner of [[Prifddinas]].
|-
|[[File:World map (14-01-2016).png|300px]]
|14 January 2016
|The centre of Great Kourend has roads added, and a stray rare tree icon was removed.
|-
|[[File:World map (21-01-2016).png|300px]]
|21 January 2016
|An area was added west of the [[Lizardman Canyon]], containing [[lizardman shaman]]s. The [[Mermaid storage unit]] was also removed.
|-
|[[File:World map (25-02-2016).png|300px]]
|25 February 2016
|A clothes shop icon was added where [[Osten]] is, and the [[Vinery]] is properly labeled now that it is accessible.
|-
|[[File:World map (03-03-2016).png|300px]]
|3 March 2016
|In Great Kourend, more pathways and roads were added, and the centre has been redesigned from a large clear field with the statue in the centre to a large, tall monument.
|-
|[[File:World map (12-05-2016).png|300px]]
|12 May 2016
|In Great Kourend, several shop and mining site icons were added, while some map icons were added to [[Ape Atoll]] with the release of [[Monkey Madness II]].
|-
|[[File:World map (01-06-2016).png|300px]]
|1 June 2016
|The [[Woodcutting Guild]] was added, and transportation icons were added for the [[Lovakengj Minecart Network]].
|-
|[[File:World map (08-09-2016).png|300px]]
|8 September 2016
|The [[Wintertodt Camp]] was added.
|-
|[[File:World map (17-11-2016).png|300px]]
|17 November 2016
|A major rework of [[Great Kourend]] was released, and an island in the shape of an easter egg was added, which would later be the location of the [[2017 Easter event]].
|-
|[[File:World map (07-01-2017).png|300px]]
|7 January 2017
|[[Mount Quidamortem]] was added.
|-
|[[File:World map (27-04-2017).png|300px]]
|27 April 2017
|Various dungeon entrances were added to relocate monsters that were once found in the [[Stronghold Slayer Cave]].
|-
|[[File:World map (06-09-2017).png|300px]]
|6 September 2017
|The map was brightened and sees the addition of [[Fossil Island]].
|-
|[[File:World map (23-11-2017).png|300px]]
|23 November 2017
|The entrance to the [[Revenant Caves]] was added, the map was cropped, and much of the [[Western Sea]] was blacked out. Labels on Fossil Island were removed.
|-
|[[File:World map (05-12-2017).png|300px]]
|5 December 2017
|The [[Corsair Cove]] and [[Myths' Guild]] was added, though the latter was not yet accessible.
|-
|[[File:World map (25-01-2018).png|300px]]
|25 January 2018
|[[Ungael]] was added, map icons were added to the Myths' Guild, and Fossil Island's labels were restored.
|-
|[[File:World map (22-05-2018).png|300px]]
|22 May 2018
|The [[Sanguinesti region]] sees the release of [[Slepe]] and [[Ver Sinhaza]]. [[Darkmeyer]] was now labeled on the map, though not yet accessible.

Some labels were changed in Great Kourend as well; namely, "Zeah" was removed from usage and the [[Kebos Lowlands]] was named.
|-
|[[File:World map (06-09-2018).png|300px]]
|6 September 2018
|The font size of the map labels were reduced, and [[Weiss]] was added to the map.
|-
|[[File:World map (10-01-2019).png|300px]]

|-

|-

|7 December 2020
|The [[Isle of Souls]] was added.
|-
|[[File:World map (27-01-2021).png|300px]]
|27 January 2021
|Some new wheat fields were added. The Ruins of Unkah and the Sea Spirit Dock, the place were players will travel to fight [[Tempoross]], were added, though it does not yet appear in game.
|-
|[[File:World map (03-06-2021).png|300px]]
|3 June 2021
|The [[Isle of Souls]] has had map icons added to it, the [[Games Zone]] and the [[Clan Hub]] have been added, and [[Shayzien]] has been reworked entirely.
|}
